EVENT_DEMO.TITLE: Events
EVENT_DEMO.PAGE_TITLE: Events of Winter War, Continuation War, and Lappland War
EVENT_DEMO.N_PHOTOGRAPHY_PHOTOS: {NUM, plural, =0{No photographs} one{One photograph taken} other{# photographs taken}}
EVENT_DEMO.HELP_TEXT_TITLE: Choose an event from the timeline or map.
EVENT_DEMO.HELP_TEXT:
There are two timelines beneath the map. The upper one is an overview of the war (one month between each vertical line). In the middle of this timeline is a time frame shown as a black box. Events that occured within this time frame are shown in the lower timeline. The vertical lines in the lower timeline represent days. You can move the timelines by dragging them with your mouse.

Click on an event on the timeline or map to get more information regarding it. Events with blue text have related photographs.

The map displays events that fall within the time frame of the upper timeline, if the place of the event is available. The events are linked to places programmatically so there may be errors in event placements. The map also displays a heatmap of Finnish casualties during the selected time frame.

Settings, such as the date range of photos retrieved for events, can be modified by clicking on "Settings" in the navigation bar on the top of the page. Clicking on "View Help" on the navigation bar displays this information.

Possible errors can be reported by sending feedback.
EVENT_DEMO.OTHER_EVENTS_AT_THE_SAME_TIME: Other events at the same time
EVENT_DEMO.OTHER_EVENTS_CLOSE: Other events in the same region
EVENT_DEMO.META_DESCRIPTION: Study the events of the war, and related photographs, people, and military units on a timeline and map.

PERSONS_DEMO.TITLE: Persons
PERSONS_DEMO.DEMO_META_DESCRIPTION_PREFIX: Persons of the Winter War, Continuation War, and Lapland War
PERSONS_DEMO.HELP_TEXT:
Search for known persons from the past Finnish wars by writing their name in the text input below and/or selecting a person from the list below. Information regarding the person and recommended links will appear on the right.

You can also view events related to the person by selecting the "timeline" tab. The view has a map with two timelines beneath it. The upper one is an overview of the war (one month between each vertical line). In the middle of this timeline is a time frame shown as a black box. Events that occured within this time frame are shown in the lower timeline. The vertical lines in the lower timeline represent days. You can move the timelines by dragging them with your mouse.

Click on an event on the timeline or map to get more information regarding it. Events with blue text have related photographs.

The map displays events that fall within the time frame of the upper timeline, if the place of the event is available. The events are linked to places programmatically so there may be errors in event placements. The map also displays a heatmap of Finnish casualties during the selected time frame.

You can also filter the events based on their type by clicking on the checkboxes above the map. Events related to military units the person has served in are also included in the timeline. You can remove these events from the timeline by deselecting the first checkbox above the map.

Settings, such as the date range of photos retrieved for events, can be modified by clicking on "Settings" in the navigation bar on the top of the page. Clicking on "View Help" on the navigation bar displays this information.

Possible errors can be reported by sending feedback.
PERSONS_DEMO.TIMELINE_HELP_TEXT:
There are two timelines beneath the map. The upper one is an overview of the war (one month between each vertical line). In the middle of this timeline is a time frame shown as a black box. Events that occured within this time frame are shown in the lower timeline. The vertical lines in the lower timeline represent days. You can move the timelines by dragging them with your mouse.

Click on an event on the timeline or map to get more information regarding it. Events with blue text have related photographs.

The map displays events that fall within the time frame of the upper timeline, if the place of the event is available. The events are linked to places programmatically so there may be errors in event placements. The map also displays a heatmap of Finnish casualties during the selected time frame.

You can also filter the events based on their type by clicking on the checkboxes above the map. Events related to military units the person has served in are also included in the timeline. You can remove these events from the timeline by deselecting the first checkbox above the map.

Settings, such as the date range of photos retrieved for events, can be modified by clicking on "Settings" in the navigation bar on the top of the page. Clicking on "View Help" on the navigation bar displays this information.

Possible errors can be reported by sending feedback.
PERSONS_DEMO.SEARCH_HELP_TEXT: Search for known persons from the past Finnish wars by writing their name in the text input below and/or selecting a person from the list below. Information regarding the person and recommended links will appear on the right. If you cannot find the person you are looking for, and know in which military unit they have served, you can take a look at the unit's timeline.
PERSONS_DEMO.NUMBER_OF_CHILDREN: {NUM, plural, =0{no children} one{one child} other{# children}}
PERSONS_DEMO.RELATED_PEOPLE_DESCRIPTION: People related to this person via events, military units, medals, or family name.

UNIT_DEMO.TITLE: Units
UNIT_DEMO.PAGE_TITLE: Finnish military units of the Winter War, Continuation War, and Lapland War
UNIT_DEMO.PAGE_META_DESCRIPTION: Finnish military unit {{unit}}: photographs, people, war diaries, battles, and other information.
UNIT_DEMO.DEMO_META_DESCRIPTION: Search and browse Finnish military units from the Winter War, Continuation War, and Lapland War.
UNIT_DEMO.DESCRIPTION: Search for military units of the Winter War, Continuation War, and Lapland War by writing their name in the text input below and/or selecting one from the list below. Events linked to the unit will appear on the map and timeline in the center of the page (in so far as there are events available for the unit), and other information and recommendation links will be displayed on the right.
UNIT_DEMO.HELP_TEXT_TITLE: Choose a unit from the menu.
UNIT_DEMO.HELP_TEXT:
There are two timelines beneath the map. The upper one is an overview of the war (one month between each vertical line). In the middle of this timeline is a time frame shown as a black box. Events that occured within this time frame are shown in the lower timeline. The vertical lines in the lower timeline represent days. You can move the timelines by dragging them with your mouse.

Click on an event on the timeline or map to get more information regarding it. Events with blue text have related photographs.

The map displays events that fall within the time frame of the upper timeline, if the place of the event is available. The events are linked to places programmatically so there may be errors in event placements. The map also displays a heatmap of casualties of the selected unit during the selected time frame.

Settings, such as the date range of photos retrieved for events, can be modified by clicking on "Settings" in the navigation bar on the top of the page. Clicking on "View Help" on the navigation bar displays this information.

Possible errors can be reported by sending feedback.
UNIT_DEMO.SEARCH_BOX_PLACEHOLDER: Seach by unit name (in Finnish), e.g. 1. Divisioona

CEMETERY_DEMO.TITLE: War Cemeteries in Finland
CEMETERY_DEMO.PAGE_META_DESCRIPTION_PREFIX: Information on, soldiers buried in, and photographs of war cemetery
CEMETERY_DEMO.APP_DESCRIPTION: You can search the cemeteries by name and narrow the results by using the filters on the left. The details of an individual cemetery can be studied by clicking the name of the cemetery.
CEMETERY_DEMO.DEMO_META_DESCRIPTION: War cemeteries of Finland: information, statistics, and photographs.
CEMETERY_DEMO.TEXT_SEARCH_EXCEPTION: The text search terms are not valid. Please try again with another set of search terms.
CEMETERY_DEMO.NAME: Name
CEMETERY_DEMO.CEMETERY_NAME_DESC: The name of the cemetery in the form "current municipality, official name of the cemetery"
CEMETERY_DEMO.NARC_NAME_DESC: Cemetery name used in National Archive's Casualties database
CEMETERY_DEMO.NUMBER_OF_GRAVES_DESC: The number of graves of soldiers as reported by the parish
CEMETERY_DEMO.FORMER_MUNICIPALITY_DESC: The former municipality according to the Sankarihautausmaat Suomessa project
CEMETERY_DEMO.CAMERA_CLUB_DESC: The camera club which carried out the photography for the Sankarihautausmaat Suomessa project
CEMETERY_DEMO.MAP_HELP: Click a map pin to see casualty details
CEMETERY_DEMO.ZOOM_PREVENTED: When old maps are visible, zooming out is prevented
CEMETERY_DEMO.PIE_CHART_HELP: Click a sector of the circle to see a list of buried people
CEMETERY_DEMO.BAR_CHART_HELP: Click a single bar to see a list of buried people
CEMETERY_DEMO.CASUALTIES_LINK: to examine the buried people with the faceted browser and visualizations of the casualties perspective.

PHOTO_DEMO.TITLE: Photographs
PHOTO_DEMO.HEADER: Photographs of Winter War, Continuation War, and Lapland War
PHOTO_DEMO.APP_DESCRIPTION: Browse photographs taken by Finnish soldiers during the Second World War. People, places, and military units have been disambiguated enabling the exploration of the context of the photographs through other data sets in WarSampo. The source of the photographs is the Finnish Defence Forces' Photographic Center's archive "SA-kuva"
PHOTO_DEMO.RESULT_ERROR: Error retrieving results. Please try again shortly by refresing the page.
PHOTO_DEMO.NO_RESULTS: No results found with the given query. Click on "View Help" on the top navigation bar for more information on searching.
PHOTO_DEMO.TEXT_SEARCH_EXCEPTION: The text search terms are not valid. Please try again with another set of search terms.
PHOTO_DEMO.HELP_TEXT:
View photos taken during the Winter War and Continuation War

More photographs are loaded when the page is scrolled down.

The results can be narrowed down using the filters on the left. Choose a value in a selection filter (e.g. a place using the place filter), or freely type text to find using the description filter.

By default, the text search uses whole words. * can be used in queries to search with partial words. For example, *pistooli will find descriptions containing the word "pristooli" as well as those containing the word "konepistooli".

The filters can be opened and closed by clicking on the plus sign and red cross, respectively. The filters restrict each other so that if a filter has a value selected, other selection facets only display values that return results.

Places and people have been linked to the photographs programmatically, so incorrect place and person assignments may be present. Possible errors can be reported by sending feedback.

Photographs may also be viewed through other WarSampo perspectives, such as Places or Events.

SETTINGS.LIMIT_TO_SAME_MUNICIPALITY: Limit photos to those taken in the same municipality as the events.
